territory.notes: While Chile traces its status as an independent nation back to 1810, it was only independent for four years before Spain reconquered it in 1814. From 1814 to 1818, Chile was reincorporated into the Viceroyalty of Peru, where it remained a colony until regaining its independence from Spain in 1818.
